basic_info.description:
üëãüèΩ I'm Abdul Arif, a graduate of the University of Windsor, with a double major in Computer Science and Business Administration. In my current role as a Software Engineer at Dayforce (Ceridian), I am part of the Web Platform team creating React components for the app and switching our code base from legacy Dojo code to React for optimal performance. And enhance our RichTextEditor performance for 5000+ global B2B customers. Currently focused on developing a custom AI solution for the RTE leveraging our in-house LLM, replacing the TinyMCE AI plugin by replicating its UI elements (dialog box, buttons, etc.) and functionalities using React, saving Dayforce approximately $52K annually. 

 Previously as a Research Software Engineer at the University, I engineered a pivotal MATLAB machine vision algorithm for Krown, utilizing RGB to HSI color conversion and pixel thresholding for accurate vehicle rust corrosion detection and assessment. I decomposed this critical MATLAB algorithm into C++ and developed an iOS app with Swift, enabling rust assessments directly from iPhones and enhancing field evaluation efficiency. Additionally, I created a Python MATLAB-based application with an intuitive GUI for advanced corrosion detection, streamlining the assessment process for vehicle rust analysis.

 As a Full Stack Developer at Haadi Solutions Inc., I lead the development of a React application for a US health clinic, designing and implementing a health intake form, integrating NodeMailer for multi-factor authentication, Azure for database management, and Twilio for SMS and voice communications.

During my Software Engineer internship at TD Bank, I rebuilt a Java automation engine used by over 50 data engineers. I successfully integrated Spring and Swagger with the Delphix Masking API, cutting the engine's runtime by 50%. Then with JUnit and Mockito, I increased the test coverage from 70% to 90%. Furthermore, I onboarded new Software Engineers, walking them through the Java code used in the automation masking engine.

I'm eager to tackle new challenges and continue making meaningful contributions as a software engineer. In the section below, you can explore some of the exciting projects I have worked on. Make sure to check out one of my favourite projects - Tradewise where we obtained over 7000 users in just 1 month.

projects.title: Amplifier AI (3rd Place Winner)
projects.description: Amplifier AI revolutionizes lead generation and customer engagement for startups and small businesses using cutting-edge AI tools. Won 3rd place for best project at the Headstarter Fellowship among 15,000+ participants and 3,000+ teams. The platform features AI-driven lead generation that scans social media platforms to identify potential customers through sentiment analysis, automatically engaging them with helpful, non-promotional solutions. It includes a smart customer service chatbot that integrates seamlessly with websites, handles appointment booking, and processes payments via Stripe. By leveraging LangChain, we optimized AI responses to ensure contextually relevant and nuanced communication tailored to each customer's specific needs. The platform also automates email campaigns and promotes products organically in relevant online communities. It demonstrates proven success in customer acquisition - as shown in our example (slide 2) for the Headstarter program!

projects.title: YourEyez (AI Visual Aid)
projects.description: YourEyez is an AI-powered computer vision app to help visually impaired people traverse their environment at ease. By leveraging GPT-4 Vision and optimized YOLOv7 models, it delivers real-time object detection and detailed scene descriptions with ~100ms latency. Built with Next.js, TypeScript, and ONNX Runtime instead of TensorFlow, it ensures optimized performance with lower latency, reduced overhead, and seamless browser compatibility. This browser-based solution empowers users with independence and a deeper connection to their environment.

projects.title: TradeWise (AI Trading Bot)
projects.description: TradeWise is a lightning-fast, AI-powered chatbot that puts the pulse of the markets at your fingertips. Fueled by the cutting-edge Llama3.1-70B-Groq engine, this digital dynamo delivers real-time financial data, interactive charts, and breaking market news with unparalleled speed and precision.

projects.title: WaveWallet (Hackathon Winner)
projects.description: Won Best UI/UX award at GrizzHacks 6 out of 30+ teams. Developed a secure Ethereum transaction platform utilizing radio frequency handshake authentication between Arduino devices. Integrated MetaMask, Web3.js, and Ethers.js for seamless NFT and cryptocurrency transactions. Designed a modern, user-friendly interface using Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and the Shadcn UI library. Utilized Moralis API for balance and transaction history. Implemented radio frequency handshake authentication and connected Arduino hardware security with the blockchain through Python and C++ backend.

projects.title: LaTeX Resume
projects.description: Resume created in LaTeX, that combines the layout of Jake's resume with the gloss of Deedy's resume.

projects.title: Battle for the Galaxy
projects.description: A capture-the-flag-styled first person shooter game composed of 4 players in teams of 2v2. Utilizes networking features to allow multiplayer functionality. Different guns, power-ups and pick ups within the game. Click title to see the code and to watch the gameplay.

projects.title: UWindsor Computer Science Wiki
projects.description: Started Open source project alongside a handful of other Computer Science students (look at last slide) to convert the old student guide website primarily written in Ruby on Rails into a better Wiki written in React.

projects.title: Robot Terminator FPS
projects.description: World is overrun with Robots and your job is to defeat them all. Exclusive Gun Skins and Gun types. For these pictures I used the Unity WebGL build and turned on INVINCIBILITY MODE. Click title to play the game. Use WASD to move, Mouse to look around, Right Click to aim, Left Click to shoot, and double tap space to use the jetpack. Enjoy!

projects.title: Windsor Traffic Data (1st Place Hackathon Winner)
projects.description: Won Traffic Data Challenge at BorderHacks 2021. This site allows local Windsorites to learn more about their local traffic in hopes to make the city a safer place. We found the best way to use the ‚ÄúTraffic‚Äù part of the City of Windsor‚Äôs OpenData API.
